senses.de: To bend over or double up so that one part covers another.
senses.ex: She folded the paper in half.

Tips.title: Physical action
Tips.description: Used to describe a physical action, often with hands, to create a crease.
Tips.example: He folded the map and put it in his pocket.

Tips.title: Visible result
Tips.description: When you fold something, the result is usually visible, like a crease or overlap.
Tips.example: After folding the napkins, the table looked very tidy.

Tips.title: Methodical order
Tips.description: Folding is often part of a methodical process, such as in cooking or organizing.
Tips.example: Please fold these shirts before putting them in the drawer.

senses.de: To fail, especially in business, or to close.
senses.ex: Due to financial difficulties, the company had to fold.

Tips.title: Metaphorical sense
Tips.description: Used metaphorically to mean giving up, especially in competition or business.
Tips.example: The player folded after playing several high-stake rounds.

Tips.title: Negative connotation
Tips.description: This sense of fold has a negative connotation, relating to failure or defeat.
Tips.example: The business eventually folded in the economic recession.

senses.ex: There are several folds in the fabric.

Tips.title: Visual texture
Tips.description: A fold in something like fabric or paper creates a visible line or texture.
Tips.example: The folds in the curtains added a nice decorative touch.

Tips.title: Characteristic feature
Tips.description: Folds can be a characteristic feature in certain objects, like clothes or geological formations.
Tips.example: The rocky landscape was marked by folds caused by ancient tectonic movements.

senses.ex: The new plan folds in ideas from various team members.

Tips.title: Inclusion process
Tips.description: To fold in is to combine, making a mixture or integration of items or ideas.
Tips.example: You need to fold in the egg whites gently to keep the batter fluffy.

Tips.title: Not always physical
Tips.description: Folding in can refer to non-physical actions, such as adding ideas to a plan.
Tips.example: The strategy meeting allowed everyone to fold in their suggestions.

senses.de: The act or process of folding.
senses.ex: She quickly got the hang of the fold.

Tips.title: Action emphasis
Tips.description: Emphasizes the action of folding, like in origami or packaging.
Tips.example: The art of paper folding is also known as origami.

senses.de: To give in or admit defeat under pressure.
senses.ex: When the opponent raised the stakes, he knew he had to fold.

Tips.title: Emotional implication
Tips.description: Folding under pressure implies a loss of courage or breakdown of resilience.
Tips.example: Despite the tough questioning, the witness refused to fold.

Tips.title: Gambling terminology
Tips.description: Commonly used in gambling to indicate withdrawing from the game, especially in poker.
Tips.example: Seeing the high bet, he decided to fold, not willing to risk more money.

Bend.wordDefinition: Bend refers to when something changes its shape by curving or twisting it, like when you bend a piece of wire into a circle.

Contract.wordDefinition:
Contract refers to making something smaller or tighter. For example, when you squeeze your hand into a fist, you are contracting your muscles.

Contract means to make something smaller or tighter, often used in business, while fold means to bend something in half or bring two parts together, often used in everyday situations.

Crease.wordDefinition:
A crease is a line or mark made on a piece of paper or fabric, usually by folding and pressing it together.

Crease is applicable when you want to create a visible line on a paper or fabric and emphasize that part of the material, while fold is applicable when you want to make the material smaller, more compact or easier to handle.

For instance, you would fold a letter before putting it into an envelope, but you would crease the edges of a book cover to give it a more polished look.

Crumple.wordDefinition:
Crumple means to crush and twist something into a loose, disordered mass, while fold means to bend one part of something over another part, typically so that it becomes smaller or neater.

You might crumple a piece of paper to throw it away, whereas you would fold a piece of paper to make it fit into an envelope.

Crumpling is usually done with something soft or flexible, like paper or cloth, while folding is often done with something rigid, like cardboard or metal.

Double.wordDefinition:
Double means to make something twice its original size or quantity. For example, if you double a recipe, you make two servings instead of one.

If you double your money, you have twice as much as you did before.

Double means to make something bigger or increase its quantity, while fold means to make something smaller or take up less space.

Gather.wordDefinition:
Gather means to bring things or people together to a common point or location. For example, you can gather clothes that are lying around in different places and put them in one basket.

Or a group of friends can gather at a park to have a picnic.

Fold means to create a crease in something and make it smaller or neat, while gather means to bring things together to make them easier to manage or to be in one place.

Pleat.wordDefinition:
Both fold and pleat are related to the act of bending something.

However, a fold is when you simply bend something in half, whereas a pleat is when you create a smaller fold by folding a larger piece of fabric back on itself.

However, if you want to create a pleated skirt, you would fold the fabric back and forth to create smaller folds.

In general, folds are used for simpler, more straightforward bends, while pleats are used to create decorative designs in clothing or to add some structure to a garment.

Tuck.wordDefinition:
Tuck means to put something into a small space or to secure something by placing a part of it inside something else.

It is applicable to things like clothes and sheets, but it is also used for more specific actions like 'tucking in' a shirt or a blanket.

For example, you might tuck in your shirt or you might tuck your sheets under your mattress at night.

Wrap.wordDefinition:
Wrap is an action to cover something completely by encasing it, such as paper or fabric.

In simpler terms, when you fold something, you make it smaller or neater by bending it, while wrapping is completely covering something as it is.

quotes.Text: When the going gets tough, I'm not always sure what you do. I'm not saying that I know how to fix everything when the going gets tough, but I do know this: when the going goes tough, you don't quit. And you don't fold up. And you don't go in the other direction.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: John Madden

quotes.Text: It is humiliating to remain with our hands folded while others write history. It matters little who wins. To make a people great it is necessary to send them to battle even if you have to kick them in the pants. That is what I shall do.
quotes.Title: Italian Politician
quotes.Name: Benito Mussolini

quotes.Text: Playboy' was not a sex magazine as far as I was concerned. Sex was simply part of the total package; I was trying to bring sex into the fold of a healthy lifestyle.
quotes.Title: American Publisher
quotes.Name: Hugh Hefner

quotes.Text: I don't need a man. But I'm happier with one. I like to have someone I can touch and squeeze and kiss. But I don't fold up and die if I don't have a man around.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Cher

quotes.Text: Standing as I do, with my hand upon this staff, and under the folds of the American flag, I ask you to stand by me so long as I stand by it.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.Text: I seem to get motivated a few months at a time, and then something stressful breaks the routine, and I just fold.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Chris Farley

quotes.Text: Know when to hold 'um, know when to fold 'um and know when to walk away from cameramen.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Kenny Rogers

quotes.Text: The want to return to the fold doesn't mean you can repeat history.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Lindsey Buckingham

quotes.Text: If they don't give you a seat at the table, bring a folding chair.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Shirley Chisholm

quotes.Text: But friendship is the breathing rose, with sweets in every fold.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
